title: How to Make Spiced Feijoa Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/160ºC convection oven.
steps.description: Prepare the cake pan with baking paper.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: In a small mixing bowl, mix together a quarter cup of brown sugar, 20g butter, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) flour and half of the cinnamon. Rub to the consistency of crumbs using your fingers. Fold in the flaked almonds. Set this topping mixture to one side.

steps.headline: Make the cake.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, whisk or beat the butter and sugar until creamed together. Add the eggs, beating in one at a time.

steps.headline: In a large mixing bowl, add the remaining sifted flour, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon and spice.
steps.description: Fold in the beaten egg and butter mixture. Combine well.

steps.headline: Pour the cake mixture into the prepared cake pan.
steps.description: Smooth the top of the cake and sprinkle the flaked almond topping over the cake mixture.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 45–55 minutes or until an inserted skewer comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Leave the cake to cool in the pan for 5 minutes; turn out onto a wire cooling rack and leave to cool.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/160ºC convection oven. Prepare the cake pan with baking paper. Make the topping. In a small mixing bowl, mix together a quarter cup of brown sugar, 20g butter, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) flour and half of the cinnamon. Rub to the consistency of crumbs using your fingers. Fold in the flaked almonds. Set this topping mixture to one side. Make the cake. In a separate bowl, whisk or beat the butter and sugar until creamed together. Add the eggs, beating in one at a time. In a large mixing bowl, add the remaining sifted flour, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon and spice. Fold in the beaten egg and butter mixture. Combine well. Add the sultanas and feijoas. Fold until well combined. Pour the cake mixture into the prepared cake pan. Smooth the top of the cake and sprinkle the flaked almond topping over the cake mixture. Place in the oven. Bake for 45–55 minutes or until an inserted skewer comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Leave the cake to cool in the pan for 5 minutes; turn out onto a wire cooling rack and leave to cool. Dust with the icing sugar. If preferred, ice.
